title: We could really use a second AP/armor item
body: I'm tired of being steamrolled by AD teams where the only thing I can build is {{item:3157}} since {{item:3047}}  got nerfed to oblivion (thanks for that by the way). Can we please make a new anti-AD assassin mage item? It would be great since AD champions can efficiently build all of {{item:3139}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3156}} to counter mages. A 5 armor buff to {{item:3157}} might also not be too unreasonable.

replies.body: 5 Armor? HA! {{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}} Zed and other assassins will just as easily melt through that.  fr though i agree with another armor/ap item. now adays i just take RoA bc health is more useful than armor.

If it will make difference between surviving with 1 hp or giving zed another 300g then its all good. 
Even if it will happen only once per 20 engages.

Astral Scimitar (inspired by {{item:3139}})

Cost: 3000 gold

Build path: {{item:3191}} + {{item:3113}} + {{item:1027}} + 700 gold

65 AP
55 Armor
5% Movement Speed

UNIQUE Passive: Block 5% of incoming physical damage and regenerate it as mana.

______________

Thoughts? I added the small mana portion because most mages go oom really easily if they rush zhonyas, so this is a good alernative. Also, the small ms boost, i dont really have an explanation, i just kinda felt like it belonged on the item. Maybe its a stupid idea idk.

Looks good but if you're going to include the sapphire crystal in the build path it really needs to have mana in it's final stats.  I would suggest replacing the sapphire crystal with a faerie charm instead because that kind of "turns in to" the unique passive.
I mean we could just move over {{item:3170}}

TBH it just looks like a really conservative bandaid fix to the issue rather than a concrete solution.

And honestly the passive is just really weak but the concept itself is toxic in the sense that if you buff it it would be blatantly overpowered.

Nothing exciting here, just raw stats and a minor mana conversion passive.

I really dont like % hp damage being a regular thing to be introduced to the game Ops too late.

AD have 2 items that can do that.

Now throw a zhonyas in there with that item and every mage becomes an armoured mage.

Overpowered, wayy too good. You now have mages rushing double seekers because the item is 150% gold efficient and can now have 150 armor by midgame. Not only that you're asking for a mana crystal and then the item doesn't even give mana when you complete it. then there's also the massive 55 armor which is 10 more than zhonyas( which the armor from that item already counters ghost+dusk pen) along with a whopping 65ap which is basically as much ap 55 ad would convert to (55ad is what ghost and dusk give). Then, even after all that, you want 5% movespeed which would help make mages harder to catch and help them macro and a % passive that blocks physical damage? so it's also mega lategame item along with being probably the hardest counter item to AD assassins in early+midgame i've ever seen.
{{item:3191}} passive is unique. It cannot stack and there is no reason for you to build double seekers.

Then you'd have mages go seekers into double cloth armor vs AD champs. there's already too much armor available that makes lethality terrible earlygame. Adding more would not solve any issues you might feel as a mage and only make AD assassins even worse early which shouldn't be the case as they are suppose to be strong early and weaker late. 

But downvote if it makes you guys think riot will actually buff armor for mages lol

Riot makes a deal about trying to make stuff viable in high elo while not stomping lower. Assassins rely on people out of position, so they shouldnt be as viable higher up, and need to be adjusted not to be extremely frustrating lower down, where MOST of the player base is. Either nerf assassins to not be as frustrating, or just give us another armor item to help us through it. And RoA/Tear doesnt involve any armor either, which is what we were asking for if you bothered to look.

The thing is, mages have a lot of high health and AP item choices. You combine that with 2 armor items and tabi, and you've effectively negated an entire class.  You're not asking for counter play, you're asking to remove the class from the game.

That's not how anything works. 2 items with meh armor + some number of items with meh hp do not invalidate an entire class, not even remotely. No mage item comes with a high amount of hp except RoA. Zhonya's doesn't have a lot of armor. Tabi is meh at best against AD assassins. Last Whisper/LDR/Mortal Reminder exist. There are other targets. Most mages are _very_ squishy. The defensive choices mages can build are not without tradeoffs. I'm currently in gold (finished last two seasons plat 5) and my games do not average 30 minutes, they average about 25-26.
I know it doesnt give any AP but {{item:3742}} works just fine on many kite mages, since you dont autoattack at all the move speed is permanent. Its not great but it keeps you alive.
